headline: Just don't come here unless you are planning to waste your time
pros: Coworkers are easy to get along
cons:
Too many, some of them included-

poor management

poor product that mainly try to scam old chinese people

undefined direction meaning CEO will always have idea without a solid and will execute anyway, so you will find you yourself working on selling their unbelievably horrible product this month then all of a sudden you will be selling another (possibly horrible) product of different industry and are completely unrelated to anything described in the contract. Metaphorically, you will be selling their so called financial subscription plan this plan, then next week you will be selling frying pans.

headline: If you have time and don't need salary, go here

cons: low salary and  cannot see the personal development

headline: Intern
cons:
1. No professional internship training at all.
2. No pay.
3. Scam. They lure international students with their Data Analyst posting but send them  to their sales department to do sales work and tell them will sponsor them to for visa. This is a “smart” tactic to make saving in budget.
4. Constantly firing people for no reason.

headline: Don't waste your time
pros: Free snacks, friendly staff, CEO buys lunch for the team or takes team out for lunch
cons:
Unpaid internship

Not enough travel reimbursement for people not coming from the city

High turnover rate

You will get fired for not working 20+ hours a week or not setting up conference calls

headline: Review
cons: Wired and embrassing coworkers, and low pay

headline: I learned a lot from this company
pros:
I have been working at ChineseInvestors.com for 7 Months at Flushing office. As a sales person, I have to say that I really learned a lot, both from co-workers and from clients. I really appreciate this job offer.
    We have brilliant fundamental and technical analysts for our VIP clients, and we have high-efficiency management team and sales team which really helped our clients a lot.  I meet clients every day, so I know these Chinese investors a lot. They really need our help, because we always give them services that best fit their needs and budgets. They can really avoid lots of traps of the stock market with our help.
 And our CEO, Warren Wang is a reputable character among Chinese investors. Lots of investors love Mr. Wang with the reason of he helped them making profits from the market. And he is a talented and approachable gentleman who you can always learn something from. Most important of all, he has been endeavored to make this company stronger. 
My manager Cathy is a strong lady. She is tough because she cares, she cares about the clients, the media, and company, other employees, and herself. I worked with and learned from her day to day.
     I think ChineseInvstors.com is the company which may has huge potential cause I saw how enthusiastic our clients were and how hard our team worked.
cons: This job involves very high volume workload, I have to work on demand and work on weekends often.
